title.rendered: Here’s how kids can learn to read with Minecraft

content.rendered:
Chapter

1. What is Minecraft?
2. Top 4 Minecraft Books

Reading is one of the most important foundations of education, from practicing languages ​​to discovering science. When a child reads, they expand their vocabulary, grammar and imagination. Books can open up new worlds for children and good reading skills are of central importance in school. In addition, reading has been shown to form new connections in the brain. 🧠

Even those who don’t read can be motivated if you just choose the right books. What topics is the child interested in? Does it have a favorite series or a favorite game? There are often book series that go with programs and games. 📚

For example, books that are set in the world of the computer game Minecraft, which is so popular with kids. Children in particular, who would rather play games than open a book, can experience reading in a positive way. 👾

What is Minecraft?

With 200 million copies sold, Minecraft is the best-selling computer game in the world and competes with Fortnite, which is also popular with kids and young people.

In Minecraft, children can discover a world with a pixelated block look, build objects and buildings and defend themselves against monsters. Depending on the game mode, the game is recommended for ages six and up. 🧱

The creative and adventure mode is particularly suitable for the younger children, here the focus is on building and dismantling the square blocks. Other game modes contain more combat elements, here players have to defend themselves against zombies or cave spiders. 🧟

Minecraft is popular with many children and adults and is also used by educational institutions because of its pedagogical possibilities. Similar to playing with Lego, there are no limits to the imagination, it is a so-called open world game. 🎮

Top 4 Minecraft Books

Here we recommend four books that are guaranteed not to be boring for children who love Minecraft. 😃

Diary of a Warrior by Cube Kid ⚔️

This Minecraft Comic Adventure is Book 1 in the Cube Kid’s best-selling book series. The visual design of the book was based on the pixelated look of the game. The content is about the adventures of 12-year-old Minus, a villager in the Minecraft world. He dreams of defeating the dangerous monsters of the block world and becoming a great warrior. Thanks to the creative illustrations and text effects, the casually and humorously written book is a lot of fun and never boring. The book is recommended for ages 10 and up.

Minecraft – The Island of Max Brooks 🏝️

In the official Minecraft novel by the games company Mojang, reading children and young people slip directly into the main character. Brooks wrote the hero’s experiences on the Minecraft island in the first-person perspective. This pulls us straight into the action-packed storyline. Similar to the game, the main character has to survive on the unknown island, discover it and have adventures. Minecraft – The Island is suitable for ages twelve and up and is a real 320-page novel. And if the adventure is fun, there are five more volumes.

Math for Minecrafters – Plus and Minus, published by Loewe Lern ​​und Puzzles ➕

Your child is a Minecraft fan, but has motivation problems in math? Targeted practice of arithmetic tasks is also possible with Minecraft books. At the same time, reading is not neglected. The book series convinces with good illustrations, variety and fun and is suitable for grades 1-2 or 3-4, depending on the volume. The math exercises are always connected to the Minecraft world. For example, the child can solve “zombie tasks” or color in motifs from the game to represent fractions.

Minecraft, Creator’s Guide by Mojang 🏰

Is your child a talented Minecraft builder or wants to become one? Then the Official Handbook for Creatives is for you. Instructions, tips and tricks introduce the possibilities of the game or expand existing knowledge. The goal of converting what you read in the book into a game can motivate many children to read. Imagination and creativity are encouraged in this way using multimedia. Depending on the child, the book is already suitable for eight to ten year olds, but is also interesting for curious parents.
